🤝 Beneficios exclusivos por ser parte de Deloitte: podrás disfrutar de un gran catálogo de beneficios y de un completo plan de retribución flexible

Si te gusta lo que lees, estos son tus próximos pasos:

  • Aplica a la oferta haciendo clic en ‘Enviar candidatura ahora’ y completa tu perfil
  • Si encajas en el puesto, nuestro equipo de talento te contactará para conocerte mejor

¡Comienza el proceso! Te iremos guiando por las diferentes fases hasta tu incorporación.

Title: Research Scientist
Description:
Company Description

NielsenIQ is a consumer intelligence company that delivers the Full View™, the world’s most complete and clear understanding of consumer buying behavior that reveals new pathways to growth. Since 1923, NIQ has moved measurement forward for industries and economies across the globe. We are putting the brightest and most dedicated minds together to accelerate progress. Our diversity brings out the best in each other so we can leave a lasting legacy on the work that we do and the people that we do it with. NielsenIQ offers a range of products and services that leverage Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to provide insights into consumer behavior and market trends. This position opens the opportunity to apply the latest state of the art in AI/ML and data science to global and key strategic projects.

Job Description

We are looking for a Research Scientist with a data-centric mindset to join our applied research and innovation team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in machine learning, deep learning, language models, GenAI and process automation. You will be responsible for analyzing data, researching the most appropriate techniques, and the development, testing, support and delivery of proof of concepts to resolve real-world and large-scale challenging problems.

Develop and apply machine learning innovations by collaborating with other team members and company stakeholders. Understand the requirements and be able to communicate results and conclusions in a way that is accurate, clear and winsome. Perform feasibility studies and analyse data to determine the most appropriate solution. Work on many different data challenges, always ensuring a combination of simplicity, scalability, reproducibility and maintainability within the ML solutions and source code. Both data and software must be developed and maintained with high-quality standards and minimal defects. Collaborate with other technical fellows on the integration and deployment of ML solutions. To work as a member of a team, encouraging team building, motivation and cultivating effective team relations.

Qualifications


PhD/Masters in a specific area of AI/ML with scientific soundness and published papers
Able to understand scientific papers and develop the idea into executable code
Hands-on expertise in Machine Learning, NLP, LMs, GenAI, signal processing and data science
Previous experience with key information extraction, product retrieval and product matching
EDA analysis and practical hands-on experience with datasets, ML models and evaluations
Python, Pytorch, Git, pandas, dask, polars, sklearn, huggingface, docker, databricks
Analytical mindset, problem solving and logical thinking capabilities
Proactive attitude, constructive, intellectual curiosity and persistence to find answers to questions
A high level of interpersonal and communication skills in English and strong ability to meet deadlines
Keen to work as part of a diverse team of international colleagues and in a global inclusive culture
A minimum of 3-5 years’ experience with evidence in a related ML field


Desired Skills


Experience working with large datasets, production-grade code and operationalization of ML solutions
Experience in MLOPs (MLFlow, Prefect) and deployment of AI/ML solutions to the cloud (esp. Azure)
Robotic Process Automation and a practical grasp of databases (SQL, ElasticSearch, Pinecone, Faiss)
Previous experience in retail, consumer, ecommerce, business, FMCG products (NielsenIQ portfolio)


Additional Information

Flexible work Model - Teams meet 1 or 2 per month at the office

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data scientist con experiencia en IA Generativa
Description:
¡En Ayesa crecemos juntos/as!




Cada profesional de nuestra empresa es importante para nosotros/as, nos ayudan a crecer de manera diversa y gracias a ellos/as somos más de 11.000 personas trabajando con el mismo objetivo en más de 40 países. ¡Únete a la multinacional española tecnológica referente en el mundo!




Si eres una persona con vocación por la tecnología y quieres continuar con tu desarrollo profesional, a la vez que concilias tu vida profesional y personal… ¡Este es tu sitio!




En esta ocasión buscamos ampliar nuestro equipo con un/a Ingeniero/a de datos Azure de datos que quieran continuar construyendo el futuro con nosotros/as desde 📍 Madrid (disponibilidad otras áreas geográficas en España)




¡Anímate a dar el salto! ¡Te estamos esperando!




Funciones:

Te incorporarás a un equipo internacional para el desarrollo de procesos y soluciones de ingesta o tratamiento de datos con Azure.

Perfil con conocimientos en:

GenAI.
Azure, deseable arquitecturas GenAI. Conocimiento en recursos: Cognitive, Search, Almacenamiento, Functions, Document intelligence

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights to the world’s visionaries and innovators in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~15,000 employees create world-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Our technical solutions – and our methods for creating them – help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.




About the Team:

Join Keysight's central AI team in Barcelona, a newly formed division dedicated to innovation and excellence in machine learning. As we build this new team from the ground up, you will have a unique opportunity to shape the future of our AI initiatives and make a significant impact from day one. Our team is a hub of innovation where top-tier researchers and engineers collaborate to create cutting-edge ML technologies that power our world-class products and services.




We are at the forefront of AI research, driving advancements in supervised and unsupervised learning, generative models, temporal learning, multimodal input streams, deep reinforcement learning, inverse reinforcement learning, and large language models. At Keysight, we are passionate about pushing the boundaries of what is possible. Our mission is to develop transformative ML solutions that address real-world, large-scale problems, ensuring our products lead the industry in performance and reliability.




As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work on pioneering projects, develop state-of-the-art algorithms, and contribute to the evolution of technologies that enable the next generation of design and test products, including those for the 6G era. We foster a dynamic and collaborative environment where innovation thrives, and every team member's contribution is valued. Our cross-functional teams work closely to integrate AI/ML solutions seamlessly into our products, ensuring that we meet and exceed the needs of our customers.




If you are driven by curiosity, inspired by challenges, and ready to make a significant impact, Keysight's central AI team is the place for you.




About the Role:

We are seeking highly qualified individuals to join our newly build AI-team as Machine Learning Engineers.




Specifically, we are looking for people with expertise in 3 areas:




1) Transformers, Generative AI, Large Language Models.

2) Machine Learning/ Deep Learning in the field of Telecommunications and Networking.

3) Pytorch experts in model optimization techniques and on-device model deployment techniques.

4) Reinforcement Learning







We are dedicated to research and development in the field of machine learning within the design and test industry. As part of the team, you will have the opportunity to be the first to work on some of the most challenging technical problems and develop innovative ML solutions that will influence the future of Keysight’s products and business operations.




You'll be developing innovative ML solutions for our next-generation design and test products, enabling 6G. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams across Keysight to ensure that the AI/ML solutions are seamlessly integrated within our products.




We're looking for someone who is self-motivated, thrives in dynamic environments, quickly builds relationships, and adapts to change and ambiguity. Strong programming skills and experience crafting, prototyping, and delivering sophisticated algorithmic solutions are essential.




Responsibilities:

Work with large datasets; extract and manipulate data using tools such as Spark SQL, command line, and scripting languages.
Design, develop, validate, and maintain predictive models and pipelines using the latest machine learning technologies.
Implement and deploy machine learning models to improve business metrics.
Develop tools to enhance the development, deployment, and lifecycle of machine learning models.
Collaborate with stakeholders, including customers and internal teams, to ensure alignment and success.
Understand and prioritize customer needs, conveying this urgency to product development teams.
Inspire and challenge development teams to achieve high performance sustainably.







Required Qualifications:

Master’s degree with 1-3 years of experience or PhD degree
In-depth knowledge of deep learning (DL) and statistical machine learning (ML)
Strong understanding of predictive modeling and machine learning algorithms (supervised and unsupervised learning, classification, regression, clustering, CNN/RNN/LSTM/Transformer, etc.)
Proficiency in programming with Python and C++
Hands-on experience with TensorFlow or PyTorch







Desired Qualifications:

Experience with the complete MLOps workflow, including data platforms, training infrastructure, and edge deployment
Passion for developing intuitive, maintainable, and well-documented software tools/apps
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, meet tight deadlines, and independently explore new ideas to improve Keysight products and operations
Creative and collaborative mindset
Strong verbal and written communication skills







What we offer:

A place within an exciting company! At Keysight we develop with our visionary, market-leading, and highly innovative customers breakthroughs that connect and secure the world. We offer you a highly competitive package. See our culture and our Benefits.







At Keysight, Inclusion, Equity & Diversity is an integral part of our core values. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers. We believe everyone should be respected in the workplace and in their communities regardless of race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, ethnicity, religion, disability, veteran status, national origin, or any protected class. We continuously challenge ourselves to grow in our understanding of inclusion by engaging in a wide variety of diversity programs, initiatives, employee network groups and mentoring/development. This is Keysight – People and Culture - Youtube.

At Keysight, Inclusion, Equity & Diversity is an integral part of our core values. Title: Data Science/ R&D Leader
Description:
Company Description

Join a dynamic and diverse global team dedicated to developing innovative solutions that uncover the complete consumer journey for our clients. We are seeking an experienced leader with strong expertise in statistics, mathematics, econometrics, or a related field. Ideally experience with consumer panel data to revolutionize the way we measure consumer behavior both online and in-store.

Job Description

About the Role


Collaborative Environment: Work in and manage an international team in a flexible and supportive setting
Methodology Enhancement: Evaluate and improve current methodologies, especially the consumer projection, and our analytical models
Research and Analysis: Lead and define the R&D for the Consumer product’s core methods. Present and communicate findings and recommendations based on rigorous research and analysis to peers and senior stakeholders
Innovative Solutions: You and your team develop prototypes of new solutions and methodologies to address challenges in a dynamic market environment
Coordination: Coordinate efforts across multiple teams and stakeholders


Qualifications

Ideally you possess a good understanding of consumer behavior, panel-based projections, and consumer metrics and analytics. You have successfully applied your statistical and data analytical skills to real-world scenarios, demonstrating your ability to handle complex data sets and generate actionable insights. Experience with (un)managed crowdsourced panels and receipt capture methodologies is an advantage. You should have experience in leading a team of experts.


Educational Background and experience: Master’s Degree or PHD in Mathematics, Statistics, Socio-economics, Data Science, or a related field with a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience with at least 2 years experience of managing a team
Statistical Expertise: Strong statistical and logical skills, with experience in outlier validation, sampling, bias reduction, indirect estimation, or data aggregation techniques
Consumer Insights: Knowledge of consumer behavior and (un)managed consumer-related crowd-sourced panels
Data Analysis Skills: Proficiency in manipulating, analyzing, and interpreting large data sets
Programming Proficiency: Strong experience with Python or another high-level programming language, with a willingness to learn Python
Continuous Learning: Eagerness to adopt and develop evolving technologies and tools. Curiosity to follow the newest research in the relevant fields and transfer to our products and business processes; potentially collaborate with academia
Communication and Collaboration: Strong communication, writing, and collaboration skills (English)


Embark on this exciting journey to transform our panel measurement business and make a significant impact in the world of consumer analytics. Apply now to be a part of our innovative team!

Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
🚀 Join Our AI Revolution!

Machine Learning Engineer Wanted

🚀 Are you passionate about pushing the boundaries of AI?

Do you dream in algorithms and wake up thinking about neural networks?

We're seeking a brilliant Machine Learning Engineer to help shape the future of our cutting-edge AI solutions!

🔬 What You'll Do:

• Design and implement scalable ML models that solve real-world problems

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions into our products

• Optimize ML algorithms for performance and efficiency

• Stay at the forefront of ML research and implement state-of-the-art techniques

🧠 What You'll Need:

• Master's or PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or related field

• 3+ years of experience building and deploying ML models in production

• Proficiency in Python (more than 5 years) and ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn)

• Strong understanding of statistical modeling and machine learning algorithms

• Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and MLOps practices

💼 Why Join Us:

• Work on projects that impact millions of users globally

• Access to cutting-edge AI hardware and resources

• Flexible work arrangements and generous time off

• Continuous learning opportunities, including conference attendance

• Competitive salary and equity package

Ready to make your mark in the world of AI? Apply now, send your CV and let's create the future together!

Do not worry if you need a working visa; we take care of it.

Please also fill : https://bit.ly/recodmeAIevaluation

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
¿Te apasiona la ciencia de datos y el desarrollo de soluciones analíticas? 👀




➥ Unirte a Innova, es formar parte de una empresa de consultoría líder a nivel nacional y en pleno desarrollo internacional. Si estás interesado en participar en proyectos innovadores de IA, Cloud Computing y Transformación Digital, creemos este es tu lugar. 🤝




En Innova-tsn buscamos incorporar profesionales con 2 o 3 años de experiencia en proyectos de ciencia de datos y modelización avanzada, para reforzar nuestro equipo en diferentes sectores como energía, retail, banca y más.




📌 ¿Qué buscamos?




Experiencia como Data Scientist de al menos 2 años en desarrollo y mantenimiento de modelos.
Conocimiento avanzado de técnicas de tratamiento y preparación de datos y analítica descriptiva.
Conocimiento del desarrollo, mantenimiento y monitorización de modelos de Machine Learning (Regresión, Clustering, XGBoost, Random Forest….) y técnicas de Forecasting.
Conocimiento avanzado de los lenguajes Python y R.
Estudios mínimos: Licenciatura/Grado en Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería, Físicas, Económicas…




✅ ...es un plus!

Buen nivel en SAS y PySpark.
Perfil matemático con habilidades técnicas en el entorno de datos.




📈 ¿Qué valoramos?




Máster en Data Science, Machine Learning, Inteligencia Artificial.
Experiencia en Desarrollo de Redes Neuronales en frameworks como Keras, Pytorch, TensorFlow.
Conocimiento/experiencia de algoritmos de Optimización.
Experiencia en el desarrollo en entornos colaborativos (Github, Gitlab).
Experiencia en MLOps.
Conocimiento de LLMs: Técnicas de Prompt Engineering, RAG y Fine tuning.
·Experiencia /certificación en plataformas Cloud (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud) tanto en el desarrollo como el despliegue de modelos.
Nivel avanzado de inglés.
Habilidad para trabajar en equipo y aportar en entornos colaborativos.




👋 ¿Qué te ofrecemos nosotros?




Contrato indefinido, invertimos y buscamos tu desarrollo a largo plazo.
Formaciones en plataformas e internas, y certificaciones oficiales a cargo de la empresa.
Planes de carrera personalizados, adaptados a tus fortalezas e intereses y basados en evaluaciones de desempeño anuales.
Beneficios sociales: seguro médico de cobertura completa.
Retribución flexible: ticket guardería y ticket restaurant.
Ser parte de un equipo especializado en soluciones empresariales y arquitectura de datos.




En Innova, fomentamos mucho el desarrollo del talento, la creatividad y el trabajo en equipo. Invertimos en espacios, tecnologías y herramientas para que los que componen nuestra compañía profundicen en sus habilidades, exploren nuevas áreas y se sientan una pieza fundamental.




Si estás buscando un lugar donde impulsar y desarrollar tu carrera profesional, únete a nosotros y sé parte de este equipo innovador 🤓

  • Habilidad para trabajar en equipo y aportar en entornos colaborativos.


👋 ¿Qué te ofrecemos nosotros?


  • Contrato indefinido, invertimos y buscamos tu desarrollo a largo plazo.
  • Formaciones en plataformas e internas, y certificaciones oficiales a cargo de la empresa.
  • Planes de carrera personalizados, adaptados a tus fortalezas e intereses y basados en evaluaciones de desempeño anuales.
  • Beneficios sociales: seguro médico de cobertura completa.
  • Retribución flexible: ticket guardería y ticket restaurant.
  • Ser parte de un equipo especializado en soluciones empresariales y arquitectura de datos.


En Innova, fomentamos mucho el desarrollo del talento, la creatividad y el trabajo en equipo. Invertimos en espacios, tecnologías y herramientas para que los que componen nuestra compañía profundicen en sus habilidades, exploren nuevas áreas y se sientan una pieza fundamental.


Si estás buscando un lugar donde impulsar y desarrollar tu carrera profesional, únete a nosotros y sé parte de este equipo innovador 🤓

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
¡UNO DE NUESTROS MEJORES CLIENTES VUELVE A AMPLIAR SU EQUIPO!




Buscamos un Data Scientist para incorporarse a un fondo de inversión noruego especializado en la recuperación de deuda financiera. El cliente es una empresa con presencia internacional y el perfil se incorporaría al departamento de Advanced Analytics en sus oficinas de Madrid.




Requisitos:

· Alrededor de 1-2 años de experiencia ejerciendo el rol de Data Scientist

· Conocimientos avanzados de Python/R

· Experiencia trabajando con algoritmos de Machine Learning

· Conocimientos avanzados de SQL

· Conocimientos de conceptos estadísticos

· Valorable experiencia utilizando herramientas como Hive/Spark, NLP y Azure Cloud

· Ubicación: Madrid

· Inglés indispensable: será el idioma de trabajo

· Formato: 100% presencial




Beneficios:

· Salario aproximado de entre 30,000-50,000€ brutos anuales, valorable según la experiencia

· Participación en proyectos internacionales

· Flexibilidad horaria con entrada de 8:00 a 10:00

· Jornada intensiva los viernes, vísperas de festivo y los meses de julio y agosto

· Actividades de salud y bienestar, fisio…

· Móvil de trabajo




¿Crees que puedes encajar? No lo dudes ¡y aplica!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are Plexus Tech. A technology company specializing in IT services and products, founded on the talent and capabilities of our people, more than 3,400 professionals developing technology with soul.

We are expanding our team! We are looking for talent!

Would you like to continue your training in cutting-edge technologies? Then you should join the Plexus family.




We are looking for a Data Scientist to work with us:




Mandatory skills:




• A strong grasp of programming fundamentals, algorithms and data structures and experience in languages such as Python and SQL variations (Hive, Impala, PostgreSQL).

• Knowledge of Data Science techniques with evidence of using them on data across supervised & unsupervised learning business problems. •

• Technical understanding of most commonly used algorithms – Linear Regressions, Random Forests, SVMs, KNN, K-means, etc.

• Experience of productionising machine learning models and creating business impact.




We offer:

Access to continuous training.

To be part of a dynamic team, committed, passionate about its customers and eager to give the best of itself.

To be part of a company with many professionals of reference in the sector.

A work ecosystem with a collaborative environment.

Permanent contract + remote work.

Flexible compensation package consisting of:

Medical insurance

Restaurant ticket

Transport ticket

Childcare ticket




Plexus Tech maintains a firm commitment to the company's Equality policies. All our selection processes take into account equal opportunities between men and women in a transversal way, being this reflected in our Equality Plan

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
¡En Qindel Group estamos creciendo!

Por ello, estamos buscando reforzar nuestro equipo con un Data Scientist con al menos 2 años de experiencia en el análisis y visualización de datos, así como en el procesado y desarrollo de modelos de ML o IA, para integrarse en un equipo multidisciplinar de trabajo, en nuestros proyectos del área de distribución.

Entre Tus Funciones, Se Encontrarán Las Siguientes


Trabajar con modelos de series temporales.
Análisis y exploración de problemas.
Desarrollo de modelos matemáticos.
Programación de prototipos.
Desarrollo de mecanismos de validación e indicadores de las soluciones desarrolladas.
Visualización de resultados.
Desarrollo de software.


Nuestra filosofía se centra en equipos dinámicos, con autonomía, y en los que fluya la comunicación. Para conseguirlo, solemos trabajar con equipos medianos o pequeños, horarios continuados, estructuras horizontales, y bajo metodologías ágiles.

¿Qué te podemos ofrecer?


Contrato indefinido.
Horario continuo: de 08:00 a 16:15 de lun-jue; 08:00 a 15:00 viernes.
Teletrabajo.
Seguro médico privado, seguro dental, de vida y accidentes.
Formación bonificada adaptada a tus necesidades.
Salario competitivo, basado en tu formación y experiencia.


Requisitos mínimos

Requisitos

Mínimos

Estudios


Grado en Matemáticas/Física o Ingeniería Informática


Tecnologías


Power BI
Python/PySpark
R
Databricks
Snowflake


Es Importante


Conocimientos en Matemática aplicada (estadística, optimización, simulación, etc.).
Experiencia con tecnologías de IA modernas (big data, machine learning, NLP, etc.).
Conocimiento de Modelos de ML o metodos de aprendizaje automático (KNN, Árboles de decisión, modelos lineales, etc...)
Almacenamiento de datos en la nube.
Conocimiento de BBDD SQL
Hadoop, Spark, etc.
Otros lenguajes de programación: Python, Scala, C/C++, etc.


Valorable


Máster o estudios específicos sobre Artificial Intelligence (AI) y/o Machine Learning (ML).
Experiencia en sector retail y/o ecommerce.
Conocimientos de Jira.

Title: Data Science - NLP (I&D)
Description:
¡Hola! Somos CAPGEMINI 😊

Tenemos la gran suerte de trabajar en un sector que lidera la evolución hacia un futuro sostenible e inclusivo. La TECNOLOGÍA. El catalizador de tantas soluciones que necesitamos ahora más que nunca.

Somos 325.000 PERSONAS en todo el mundo unidas por una misma pasión.

No importa dónde estemos, podemos estar en casa, en la oficina, a mil quilómetros de distancia unxs de otrxs, pero somos conscientes de que NUESTRO TRABAJO CUENTA.

No importa en qué momento vital estemos, somos DIVERSOS en edad, género, ascendencia, familia… ¡nos hemos certificado en Diversidad y como empresa ÉTICA más de 9 años seguidos!

No importa si tu fase es de crecimiento, APRENDIENDO y FORMÁNDOTE a todas horas o si necesitas consolidarte y aprecias la FLEXIBILIDAD, la CONCILIACION y los BENEFICIOS fiscales y sociales para compaginar tu vida personal y profesional. Lo que importa es que puedes sentir que estás DONDE DEBES ESTAR para conseguir el futuro que deseas.

Cada proyecto CUENTA. ¿Te apetece sumarte a CAPGEMINI y participar en nuestros proyectos? En este caso, empezarías en el sector Seguros, pero la diversidad de proyectos en sectores diferentes te va a proporcionar gran versatilidad y también la oportunidad de especializarte en alguno en concreto, si es tu deseo.

En cuanto al equipo, vas a poder trabajar con equipos diversos, para cada proyecto se constituye un equipo diferente, de distintas ciudades, por lo que tendrás relación con personas que están más allá de tu centro de trabajo o de tu lugar de residencia. Piensa que también colaboramos con otras sedes de Capgemini a nivel mundial… así que tu red de colegas no tendrá límite!!

Nuestro objetivo es poder brindar a nuestros clientes herramientas que le ayuden a tener éxito y conseguir sus propios objetivos. ¿Cómo? A través de nuestra excelencia en conocimiento y metodología, nuestra expertise y nuestro estilo de relación colaborativa con los clientes.

¿Cuál será tu misión?

Tu misión será liderar, impulsar y desarrollar técnicamente con autonomía iniciativas en el ámbito de la inteligencia artificial y también:

Diseñarás, desarrollarás y realizarás el despliegue de soluciones usando modelos de Machine Learning y Deep Learning.

Gestionarás y manipularás conjuntos de datos: Definición e identificación de variables de aprendizaje, generación de nuevos conjuntos, realización de transformaciones y limpieza.

Definirás procesos de Aprendizaje Automático End-to-End.

Desarrollarás procesos de inferencia en entornos On-premise o Cloud.

Realizarás el mantenimiento de modelos existentes de Aprendizaje Automático.

Liderarás equipos técnicos de proyecto.

Realizarás la mentorización de Data Scientists Junior o en formación.

Participarás en propuestas técnicas a nivel nacional e internacional.




🔍 ¿Qué buscamos?

Para sentirte a gusto en la posición es necesario que aportes Grado en Informática, Matemáticas, Física o Ingenierías similares.

Experiencia profesional significativa en el desarrollo y aplicación de modelos de optimización y simulación para mejorar el proceso de toma de decisiones, así como buenas habilidades relacionadas con el análisis de datos, estadísticas y técnicas computacionales.




Experiencia en proyectos de NLP y conocimientos de LLMs.




• Auténtico entusiasmo por el modelado de procesos de negocio así como de sistemas complejos de ingeniería mediante programación matemática con el objetivo de optimización (planificación y programación) y simulación.

• Experiencia con problemas de programación matemática: LP, MIP, NLP, MINLP, CP así como con modelado de incertidumbre (optimización robusta y estocástica)

• La experiencia con optimización metaheurística (algoritmos genéticos, ACO, inteligencia de enjambre, programación evolutiva, etc.) es una ventaja

• Excelentes habilidades de codificación con python (pyomo, pulp, gurobi, localsolver, etc.). GAMS también es una ventaja

• Comprensión completa de algoritmos de solución de optimización (descenso de gradiente, método de punto interior, simplex, etc.) y solucionadores (CPLEX, CBC, etc.)

• Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y presentación, y capacidad para explicar conceptos complejos.

• Habilidad a nivel profesional en los idiomas español e inglés.

• Las habilidades de análisis comercial y gestión de proyectos serían una ventaja.







🌟 Además, sería genial si tienes:

PhD o Máster en ciencias de computación, ciencia de datos, inteligencia artificial, matemáticas o estadística.




Conocimiento y aplicación de la ciencia de datos en diferentes sectores e industrias: banca, seguros, telco, retail, etc.




¿Qué te espera en esta posición?

Pertenecerás a un departamento global y podrás trabajar de manera colaborativa con ingenieros de diferentes países.
Proyectos CLOUD (AWS, Azure, GCP) y/o enterprise.
Puerta abierta a proyectos internacionales sin necesidad de salir fuera, ya que todos los proyectos se hacen desde España.
Tribus de especialización por tecnología y compañerismo en comunidades.




Valoraremos todas las candidaturas. En Capgemini contamos con una amplísima oferta formativa, presencial, online de Certificaciones, etc. Aunque no tengas el 100% de los conocimientos valorados ¡nos encantará conocerte!




La colaboración es clave en el desarrollo de nuevas ideas, de nuevas soluciones, del crecimiento profesional y personal y por eso para nosotrxs es vital el equipo y el buen clima. Trabajamos y potenciamos nuestras COMUNIDADES dentro de la compañía.




Tenemos un CATALOGO DE MEDIDAS de desarrollo y conciliación muy completo (ayudas familiares, seguros y tickets, días festivos adicionales de tiempo para ti y lxs tuyxs, etc…) ¿Nos vemos y te lo contamos?




Hoy has conocido algo más sobre nosotrxs y nuestro proyecto en crecimiento. Mañana saldrán otros proyectos porque así trabajamos, generando soluciones a medida que se nos necesita ¿Te unes al equipo hoy? 😊







TE QUEREMOS EN EL ÁREA DE Insights & Data 📊 es una línea de negocio global y somos más de 25.000 profesionales y vamos a seguir creciendo 🚀😊.




Conócenos Insights & Data: bit.ly/3mBZoku




¿Te animas a formar parte de Capgemini?




¡Te esperamos!




En Capgemini estamos comprometidos con la diversidad y la inclusión. La diversidad es fuente de innovación e inspiración. Apostamos por profesionales, sin importar etnia, identidad de género, discapacidad, orientación sexual o cualquier otra dimensión de diversidad.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
FI Group es la empresa de consultoría de innovación más grande de Europa y estamos buscando un científico de datos para unirse a nuestra empresa.




Educación:

Grado en Matemáticas, Estadística, Informática o similares.
Máster en Data Science o Inteligencia Artificial es un plus.
Nivel de inglés medio.




Conocimientos técnicos:

Sólido dominio de lenguajes de programación como Python, R, Java, o C++.
Experiencia con bibliotecas y marcos específicos como TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, scikit-learn y pandas.
Conocimiento de algoritmos de machine learning, incluido el aprendizaje supervisado y no supervisado.
Experiencia en deep learning, con una sólida comprensión de las redes neuronales artificiales.
Capacidad para procesar y analizar grandes volúmenes de datos, experiencia en big data.
Conocimiento en React, .NET Core framework y componentes Ant Design (para front, back-end y componente UI).




Experiencia en infraestructura de IA:

Conocimiento en infraestructura cloud como AWS o Azure para alojar y desplegar modelos de IA.
Experiencia con contenedores y orquestación, utilizando herramientas como Docker y Kubernetes.
Estar familiarizado con plataformas de IA y ML como Azure Machine Learning.
Comprensión de GPUs y hardware especializado para entrenamiento e inferencia de modelos de IA.
Capacidad para implementar pipelines de datos y modelos de forma eficiente y segura.
Experiencia en escalado y gestión de recursos para optimizar el rendimiento y costes.




Experiencia:

Experiencia demostrable en diseño y Desarrollo de modelos de IA aplicados a problemas de negocio.
Experiencia trabajando con bases de datos y herramientas ETL/ELT.
Experiencia en despliegue de modelos en producción y conocimiento de MLOps.
Más de 3 años de experiencia en funciones relacionadas con la analítica de datos, la digitalización o en departamentos de IT y operaciones.




Capacidad analítica:

Fuerte capacidad analítica para interpretar datos completes y convertirlos en insights de negocio.
Experiencia en optimización de hiperparámetros y mejora de precisión de los modelos.




Soft Skills:

Excelentes dotes comunicativas para explicar conceptos técnicos a personal no técnico.
Capacidad para trabajar en equipo y colaborar con otros departamentos, unidades de negocio y partes interesadas de diferentes países.
Pensamiento crítico y resolución de problemas.

Show more
HTML:
FI Group es la empresa de consultoría de innovación más grande de Europa y estamos buscando un científico de datos para unirse a nuestra empresa.


Educación:

  • Grado en Matemáticas, Estadística, Informática o similares.
  • Máster en Data Science o Inteligencia Artificial es un plus.
  • Nivel de inglés medio.


Conocimientos técnicos:

  • Sólido dominio de lenguajes de programación como Python, R, Java, o C++.
  • Experiencia con bibliotecas y marcos específicos como TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, scikit-learn y pandas.
  • Conocimiento de algoritmos de machine learning, incluido el aprendizaje supervisado y no supervisado.
  • Experiencia en deep learning, con una sólida comprensión de las redes neuronales artificiales.
  • Capacidad para procesar y analizar grandes volúmenes de datos, experiencia en big data.
  • Conocimiento en React, .NET Core framework y componentes Ant Design (para front, back-end y componente UI).


Experiencia en infraestructura de IA:

  • Conocimiento en infraestructura cloud como AWS o Azure para alojar y desplegar modelos de IA.
  • Experiencia con contenedores y orquestación, utilizando herramientas como Docker y Kubernetes.
  • Estar familiarizado con plataformas de IA y ML como Azure Machine Learning.
  • Comprensión de GPUs y hardware especializado para entrenamiento e inferencia de modelos de IA.
  • Capacidad para implementar pipelines de datos y modelos de forma eficiente y segura.
  • Experiencia en escalado y gestión de recursos para optimizar el rendimiento y costes.


Experiencia:

  • Experiencia demostrable en diseño y Desarrollo de modelos de IA aplicados a problemas de negocio.
  • Experiencia trabajando con bases de datos y herramientas ETL/ELT.
  • Experiencia en despliegue de modelos en producción y conocimiento de MLOps.
  • Más de 3 años de experiencia en funciones relacionadas con la analítica de datos, la digitalización o en departamentos de IT y operaciones.


Capacidad analítica:

  • Fuerte capacidad analítica para interpretar datos completes y convertirlos en insights de negocio.
  • Experiencia en optimización de hiperparámetros y mejora de precisión de los modelos.


Soft Skills:

  • Excelentes dotes comunicativas para explicar conceptos técnicos a personal no técnico.
  • Capacidad para trabajar en equipo y colaborar con otros departamentos, unidades de negocio y partes interesadas de diferentes países.
  • Pensamiento crítico y resolución de problemas.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Arbolus

Arbolus is reinventing the traditional and analog expert network industry by bringing technology to the forefront of knowledge sharing. Our platform helps hundreds of clients worldwide to connect with the best experts, collect high-quality insights faster, and streamline their processes using leading AI technology.




Headquartered in London, we are a venture-backed scale-up working with global consulting and leading private equity firms. With offices in Barcelona, New York, and Gurgaon, we have a truly international team of over 150 people.

Recently listed as one of Europe’s top 100 fastest-growing companies, we are building a team that can continue to support our ambitious growth plans.




About the role

You will be a creator of data visualization dashboards and looking over extracting data insights to identify strategic opportunities. You will also leverage advanced statistics and machine-learning techniques to uncover data patterns and create machine-learning models.




Key responsibilities you will be in charge of

Proactively investigate and analyze business trends to find actionable insights
Support the company by creating dashboards and enabling data-driven decision-making.
Collect, clean, and merge data to validate hypotheses & designs
Create and maintain Machine Learning models




About you

We are looking for an ambitious individual with great business and technical skills, and the ability to analyze different sources of information, create visualizations, and explain their findings to the stakeholders.




Requirements to succeed in this role

Bachelor's degree in computer science, maths engineering, or a quantitative field
2+ years experience in a data scientist role
Knowledge of SQL and experience working with databases
Experience with Python or R and Machine Learning libraries (Scikit-Learn, XGBoost, Keras, PyTorch, etc.)
Experience with HuggingFace and other Machine Learning tools
The ability to effectively communicate your analyses to business and technical audiences
Excellent verbal and written English communication skills
Self-driven, agile, and able to work independently and on multiple engagements simultaneously

Nice to have

Proficient with Excel or Google Spreadsheets
Basic understanding of SQL pipelines (DBT) and other software development tools, such as git
Experience with business intelligence platforms (e.g. Tableau, Google Data Studio, or similar)
Experience applying a wide range of statistical techniques to data sets, and understanding their real-world advantages/drawbacks




What we offer

Variable bonus on top of your base salary
25 days of paid time off per year + all local bank holidays. Arbolus puts heavy emphasis on quality of life and wants to ensure everyone has a fair amount of time to recharge and relax
Flexibility with local bank holidays
Share option plan for all employees
Private health insurance
Flexible remuneration for meals and transport
Relocation package to help you with your move to Barcelona
2 weeks per year to work from abroad
Top-notch equipment to make our work efficient and smooth
Free coffee, tea, and snacks to boost our energy during the day
Monday office breakfast to start our week and Friday lunch voucher
Regular social activities managed by our local Social Committees
Language courses to extend our knowledge (English, Spanish, French, and Catalan)
Office First organization




Arbolus is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual’s race, color, religion, national origin, sex, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

*Please be advised that at this moment Arbolus is not able to provide support in the visa sponsorship process.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
📊 Unlock the Power of Data! Seeking Exceptional Data Scientist 📊

Are you a data wizard who can turn raw information into actionable insights?

We're looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our innovative team and drive data-driven decision-making across our organization!

🔍 What You'll Do:

• Develop advanced analytics models to solve complex business problems

• Collaborate with stakeholders to identify opportunities for data-driven solutions

• Create compelling data visualizations and reports for executive leadership

• Build and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes

📚 What You'll Need:

• Master's or PhD in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field

• 5+ years of experience in Python programming

• 4+ years of experience in a data science role

• Strong programming skills in Python or R, and proficiency with SQL

• Experience with big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark) and cloud platforms

• Excellent communication skills to present complex findings to non-technical audiences

🌟 Why Join Us:

• Work on diverse projects across multiple industries

• Access to large-scale, unique datasets

• Regular hackathons and innovation challenges

• Professional development budget for courses and certifications

• Competitive compensation package with performance bonuses

Ready to turn data into gold? Apply now, send your CV and let's create the future together!

Do not worry if you need a working visa; we take care of it.

Please also fill : https://bit.ly/recodmeAIevaluation

Title: Machine Learning Engineer with English
Description:
Are you interested in joining a world-leading company that prioritizes innovation and supports your professional growth?

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will collaborate with teams to apply machine learning to the digital transformation of business processes, enhancing the client experience with the company’s products and solutions. Working closely with software engineers and Data Scientists you will tackle real-world business challenges using advanced machine learning techniques.

Your responsibilities include delivering impactful products that directly influence people’s lives.

Take the next exciting step and be part of our journey to revolutionize the field of human capital management!




Languages

Full professional level of English




Main Responsibilities

Create and deploy Machine Learning systems utilizing programming languages, frameworks, and tools like Python, AWS, and Databricks
Collaborate with engineering and product teams within an Agile environment to discover, design, develop, and implement advanced Machine Learning solutions
Builds solutions on top of LLM
Demonstrate proficiency in constructing models, specifically in domains such as NLP, deep learning, classification algorithms, or recommender systems
Produce impeccable code and documentation, advocate for and establish best practices to generate adaptive, high-performing, and continuously learning AI models and systems
Provide guidance and support for the professional development of fellow team members through mentoring




Core Skills/experience

Hold a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field, or an equivalent qualification
Possess 3-5 years of experience, honing and developing the relevant skills required for this role, gained through work in a similar or related capacity
Have a high level of proficiency in Python, including popular data science packages (Pandas, Sklearn, etc.), a strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and methods used for data science and machine learning, and familiarity with natural language processing.
Nice to have: Experience with AWS cloud solutions like Lambda and SageMaker, as well as expertise in CI/CD tools like Jenkins and non-relational databases (NoSQL) and exposure to platforms like Databricks, MLflow, and Jupyter notebooks




What’s on offer

Permanent contract
Competitive salary
Benefits package: health insurance, life assurance and other interesting perks
Hybrid work model (mix of office & home-based)
Possibility to grow in an international company




Our recruitment process

Step 1: Interview with one of our Recruiters to get to know you better
Step 2: Phone call with HR
Step 3: Technical Interview with the company's Hiring Manager & Team
Step 4: Final interview

Title: Prácticas data scientist
Description:
Cognodata es una empresa líder en el sector de Customer Science y Advanced Analytics, dedicada a la generación de resultados de negocio mediante la gestión avanzada de la información de clientes, requiere a una persona para realizar prácticas como data Scientist.

Sus Principales Responsabilidades Serán


Colaboración en proyectos de Business Intelligence segmentación BBDD de clientes para calcular su valor, propensión a la compra de productos, etc.
Desarrollo herramientas de gestión de la información de clientes y de las campañas de marketing.
Confeccionar documentación.
Participar en el diseño de módulos y herramientas nuevas.
Optimización de procesos y cargas de datos.
Auditoría de información.
Análisis estadístico descriptivo. Diseño e implementación de modelos avanzados de aprendizaje automático (machine learning).


Podemos Ofrecerte

Convenio de prácticas mínimo 6 meses: con posibilidad real de contratación

Formación

Buen ambiente laboral

Flexibilidad horaria.

Jornada intensiva en julio y agosto.

Teletrabajo: híbrido.

¿Quieres conocer más? ¡Ínscribete!

Requisitos mínimos

Deberá Tener Conocimientos Específicos En


Imprescindible nivel medio-alto en SQL Server (se pasará prueba)
Nivel alto en python y diferentes librerías (se pasará prueba)
Valorable conocimientos en AWS, Spark, hive....
Imprescindible disponibilidad inmediata
Capacidad para extraer conclusiones con sentido de negocio.
Inglés alto

Title: DATA SCIENTIST RESEARCHER
Description:
FIATC Seguros busca un/a Data Scientist altamente motivado/a y capacitado/a para unirse a su equipo en el área de Estrategia y Desarrollo Corporativo. El candidato/a seleccionado/a desempeñará un papel clave en la recopilación, análisis e interpretación de grandes volúmenes de datos con el objetivo de optimizar la toma de decisiones estratégicas, mejorar la eficiencia operativa y desarrollar nuevas oportunidades de negocio.




Responsabilidades:

Analizar y procesar grandes conjuntos de datos relacionados con el sector de seguros y financieros.
Desarrollar modelos predictivos y prescriptivos para la evaluación de riesgos, comportamiento del cliente y optimización de productos.
Colaborar con equipos multidisciplinarios (marketing, ventas, desarrollo de productos) para identificar oportunidades de mejora y nuevos enfoques basados en datos.
Automatizar procesos de análisis de datos y mejorar la eficiencia operativa mediante la implementación de herramientas avanzadas de análisis.
Comunicar los hallazgos y recomendaciones a los líderes de negocio y partes interesadas, a través de informes claros y visualizaciones comprensibles.
Aplicar técnicas de machine learning, inteligencia artificial y análisis estadístico para resolver problemas complejos relacionados con la estrategia empresarial.
Monitorear y mejorar continuamente los modelos y las herramientas implementadas, asegurando su precisión y relevancia en el tiempo.
Mantenerse al día con las tendencias emergentes en ciencia de datos, tecnologías financieras y aseguradoras.




Requisitos:

Título universitario en Estadística, Matemáticas, Informática, Ingeniería o áreas afines. Un máster o doctorado será valorado positivamente.
Experiencia mínima de 2-4 años como Data Scientist, preferiblemente en el sector asegurador, financiero o consultoría estratégica.
Sólidos conocimientos en modelado estadístico, machine learning y análisis predictivo.
Dominio de lenguajes de programación como Python, R o SQL.
Experiencia con herramientas de visualización de datos (Power BI, Tableau, etc.).
Capacidad para traducir datos complejos en insights estratégicos y acciones claras.
Habilidad para trabajar en equipo y colaborar con diferentes departamentos.
Fuerte capacidad analítica y orientada a la resolución de problemas.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita en español e inglés.




Competencias Deseadas:

Familiaridad con plataformas cloud para análisis de datos (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Conocimiento en la implementación de soluciones de inteligencia artificial y automatización.
Experiencia en proyectos de transformación digital y mejora de procesos.




Ofrecemos:

Proyecto profesional estable con Plan de Carrera. Presencial.
Integración en un equipo dinámico dentro de una empresa líder en el sector de seguros.
Oportunidades de desarrollo profesional y formación continua.
Remuneración competitiva según experiencia y habilidades.
Beneficios sociales (Descuento en seguros FIATC) y un ambiente laboral estimulante.
Plan de jubilación.
Retribución flexible.
28 días de descanso anuales.




Proceso de Selección: Las candidatas y candidatos interesados pueden enviar su currículum y carta de motivación a través de esta plataforma. Atenderemos todas las inscripciones.

¡Únete a FIATC Seguros y ayuda a liderar el futuro del análisis de datos en el sector asegurador!

Title: Data Science Specialist
Description:
As a Data Scientist, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex data from various sources. Your work will involve using advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to extract actionable insights, develop predictive models, and contribute to data-driven strategies. You will use structured, unstructured and streaming data, and communicates clearly the results and implications of the data analysis and hypothesis driven approach to senior leaders, including productionising with product delivery teams.




• Lead data science from ideation (hypothesis) to deployment, working with stakeholders across the aviation industry.

• Apply advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to analyze large and complex data sets, such as flight data, weather data, air traffic data, Operational data and customer data etc.

• Develop and maintain data pipelines, data models, dashboards and reports to support data-driven decision making.

• Communicate insights and recommendations to internal and external audiences, using clear and compelling data visualizations and narratives.







Key Responsibilities:




Data Analysis and Machine Learning: Collect, clean, and analyze data, apply statistical techniques, and develop machine learning models for predictive analytics.
Data Visualization and Communication: Create visualizations and reports using various tools to communicate insights and support decision-making.
Predictive Modeling and Advanced Techniques: Build predictive models using time series, NLP, and other techniques for forecasting and optimization.
Data Governance and Continuous Improvement: Ensure data privacy and quality, stay updated on AI/ML trends, and contribute to team knowledge sharing.
Leadership and Problem-Solving: Lead and mentor junior data scientists, and apply expertise to solve complex data challenges while optimizing effort and value.




Qualifications: & Experience




- Bachelor's or master's degree in data science, computer science, statistics, or a related field.

- Minimum of 10+ years of experience in data science, analytics, or a related role.

- Strong proficiency in data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning.

- Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R.

- Experience with data visualization tools and libraries.

- Knowledge of data manipulation, ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, and data cleansing.

- Excellent problem-solving, communication, and teamwork skills.

- Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

- 10+ years in the travel or aviation industry, specifically in Operations, Customer (Including Catering), Engineering & Maintenance or Commercial or a significant value delivered through your work.




About you




• Excellent communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written.

• Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills.

• Curiosity and passion for learning new skills and technologies.

• Able to operate in a fast paced, ambiguous environment driving value through structured thinking and hypothesis driven testing.

• Able to be in new offices (BCN) – 2-3 days per week.

• Comfortable communicating with senior executives

• Energised to take on the most complex problems to solve

• Passion for raising the standard and credibility of Data science within an organisation, and group of companies.

• Leadership + Data science + AI + Aviation mastery




For this you will have:

- Budget of 1.200€ in individual training for you to use it in whatever you want (technological events, books, trainings, certifications etc.).

- Follow-up with your team every month for continuous feedback.

- Telework 2 days a week.

- Flexible hours to help you reconcile your professional / family life.

- Private medical insurance fully paid by Capitole.

- Flexible remuneration (restaurant tickets, transport and/or childcare).

- Andjoy (Gymforless)

- Discounts on major brands for employees (Club Capitole).




To get to know Capitole!!

- Team Buildings every two months - you can't miss the summer party or Christmas dinner!

- Soccer team sponsored by Capitole.

- Technological communities for you to share your knowledge and ideas with the other teams, sharing internal knowledge is essential!!!!

- Last but not least a TEAM! Don't know us yet? Discover us!!! https://capitole-consulting.com/




See what people are saying about us https://www.glassdoor.es/Opiniones/Capitole-Consulting-Opiniones-E2060890.htm




Don't hesitate to send us your profile, we look forward to meeting you!

HTML:
As a Data Scientist, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex data from various sources. Your work will involve using advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to extract actionable insights, develop predictive models, and contribute to data-driven strategies. You will use structured, unstructured and streaming data, and communicates clearly the results and implications of the data analysis and hypothesis driven approach to senior leaders, including productionising with product delivery teams.


• Lead data science from ideation (hypothesis) to deployment, working with stakeholders across the aviation industry.

• Apply advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to analyze large and complex data sets, such as flight data, weather data, air traffic data, Operational data and customer data etc.

• Develop and maintain data pipelines, data models, dashboards and reports to support data-driven decision making.

• Communicate insights and recommendations to internal and external audiences, using clear and compelling data visualizations and narratives.



Key Responsibilities:


  1. Data Analysis and Machine Learning: Collect, clean, and analyze data, apply statistical techniques, and develop machine learning models for predictive analytics.
  2. Data Visualization and Communication: Create visualizations and reports using various tools to communicate insights and support decision-making.
  3. Predictive Modeling and Advanced Techniques: Build predictive models using time series, NLP, and other techniques for forecasting and optimization.
  4. Data Governance and Continuous Improvement: Ensure data privacy and quality, stay updated on AI/ML trends, and contribute to team knowledge sharing.
  5. Leadership and Problem-Solving: Lead and mentor junior data scientists, and apply expertise to solve complex data challenges while optimizing effort and value.


Qualifications: & Experience


- Bachelor's or master's degree in data science, computer science, statistics, or a related field.

- Minimum of 10+ years of experience in data science, analytics, or a related role.

- Strong proficiency in data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning.

- Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R.

- Experience with data visualization tools and libraries.

- Knowledge of data manipulation, ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, and data cleansing.

- Excellent problem-solving, communication, and teamwork skills.

- Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

- 10+ years in the travel or aviation industry, specifically in Operations, Customer (Including Catering), Engineering & Maintenance or Commercial or a significant value delivered through your work.


About you


• Excellent communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written.

• Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills.

• Curiosity and passion for learning new skills and technologies.

• Able to operate in a fast paced, ambiguous environment driving value through structured thinking and hypothesis driven testing.

• Able to be in new offices (BCN) – 2-3 days per week.

• Comfortable communicating with senior executives

• Energised to take on the most complex problems to solve

• Passion for raising the standard and credibility of Data science within an organisation, and group of companies.

• Leadership + Data science + AI + Aviation mastery


For this you will have:

- Budget of 1.200€ in individual training for you to use it in whatever you want (technological events, books, trainings, certifications etc.).

- Follow-up with your team every month for continuous feedback.

- Telework 2 days a week.

- Flexible hours to help you reconcile your professional / family life.

- Private medical insurance fully paid by Capitole.

- Flexible remuneration (restaurant tickets, transport and/or childcare).

- Andjoy (Gymforless)

- Discounts on major brands for employees (Club Capitole).


To get to know Capitole!!

- Team Buildings every two months - you can't miss the summer party or Christmas dinner!

- Soccer team sponsored by Capitole.

- Technological communities for you to share your knowledge and ideas with the other teams, sharing internal knowledge is essential!!!!

Title: DATA SCIENCE
Description:
Forma parte de una compañía puntera en el sector seguros

Aplicamos tecnología de vanguadia en el sector seguros. Crece con nosotros y lidera proyectos pioneros en este sector.

¿Cómo es trabajar en Reale ITES?

En Reale ITES ofrecemos la experiencia y estabilidad que solo una gran empresa con gran recorrido puede ofrecer.

El lugar de empleo será en nuestra oficina del centro de Madrid, con un horario de jornada completa e intensiva, dependiendo de la época del año, y teletrabajo varios días a la semana.

Se ofrece un contrato indefinido con un salario atractivo e interesantes beneficios sociales. Reale Seguros cuenta con los reconocimientos mejor valorados para trabajar en una empresa: Great Place to Work, Empresa Familiarmente Responsable, Igualdad en la Empresa y Sellos de Horarios Racionales.

¿A quién estamos buscando?

Estamos buscando un talentoso Especialista en Data Scientist para unirse a nuestro equipo de Data y trabajar de la manos de diferentes áreas de negocio.

Trabajarás en estrecha colaboración con personal de Negocio, Data/AI/Visualization Engineers, IT Architects, SW Engineers en los diferentes proyectos en los que se requiera.

Buscamos personas con clara orientación al cliente interno, alto nivel de ejecución, autodesarrollo y visión estratégica. Imprescindible aportar nivel B2 mínimo de ingles.

¿Qué tendrás que hacer?

Participaras en proyectos de Data Science y en el desarrollo de estrategias en base a las lineas de negocio.

Algunas de las funciones más específicas

Comprender las necesidades de las líneas de negocio y saber cómo traducirlas en términos de análisis de datos y modelos cuantitativos de Analítica Avanzada e Inteligencia Artificial.

Desarrollar el conocimiento de los datos recopilados y su estructura, así como de los sistemas en los que están contenidos hasta donde sea preciso para la realización con éxito de su actividad.

Desarrollar prototipos rápidos y soluciones piloto que permitan a las áreas de negocio un mejor entendimiento de las soluciones de Data Science propuestas.

Investigar nuevas técnicas dentro de las disciplinas bajo su competencia (Analítica Avanzada e Inteligencia Artificial) y sugerir e impulsar cambios guiados por los datos (Data Driven) que contribuyan a mejorar los resultados de Negocio.

Presentar resultados a un público no técnico, tanto a través de informes regulares como en reuniones y presentaciones.

Convertirse en punto de contacto y referencia para los interlocutores de las áreas de negocio con las que se colabore.

Analizar y valorar opciones make/buy para dar solución a las necesidades de negocio y la estrategia definida por la organización, colaborando con proveedores externos y fabricantes de soluciones cuando sea necesario a tales efectos.

Participar en equipos multidisciplinares (Negocio, Data/AI/Visualization Engineers, IT Architects, SW Engineers) en los diferentes proyectos en los que se requiera.

Para Data Products específicos, coordinar la elaboración del entregable técnico a producir por el equipo de desarrollo (Data Scientists, Data Engineers, AI/MLOps engineers, Data Visualization Engineers, SW Engineers, …).

¿Cómo será el proceso de selección?

Regístrate

Rellena el formulario de registro. No te llevará más de un minuto

Test Online

Realiza las pruebas que nos ayudarán a entender tu perfil y fortalezas

Conoce al equipo

Participa de nuestra entrevista personal para conocer mejor tus intereses y motivaciones

¡Bienvenido a Reale!

Entra a formar parte de nuestra compañía!
Show more

Title: AI Engineer - Spain
Description:
This is a remote position.

Note: One of our clients is building a new team and hiring 8 AI Engineers globally. This is a 100% remote role. This role does not offer any visa sponsorship.

Job Summary:

As an AI Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing AI models and algorithms that solve complex business problems. You will work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and product teams to integrate AI solutions into our products. Your role will involve researching the latest AI technologies, building scalable machine learning models, and optimizing algorithms for performance and accuracy.

Key Responsibilities:


Design, develop, and deploy AI models and algorithms that address business needs and challenges.
Collaborate with data scientists and software engineers to collect, preprocess, and analyze large datasets.
Implement machine learning and deep learning models using frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Keras.
Optimize and tune models for performance, accuracy, and scalability.
Integrate AI solutions into production systems, ensuring seamless operation and reliability.
Research and stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI, machine learning, and data science.
Develop and maintain documentation for AI models, processes, and best practices.
Participate in code reviews and provide feedback to ensure high-quality code and adherence to best practices.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to AI models and systems in production environments.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure AI solutions align with business goals and objectives.


Qualifications:


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in AI, machine learning, or a related field.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java.
Experience with machine learning frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, or Scikit-learn.
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, neural networks, natural language processing (NLP), and computer vision.
Experience with data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation techniques.
Familiarity with cloud platforms and tools for AI and machine learning (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud, Azure).
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work with complex datasets.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Ability to manage multiple projects and deliver results on time.


Preferred Qualifications:


Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, AI, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Kafka.
Knowledge of reinforcement learning, generative models, or advanced neural architectures.
Familiarity with DevOps practices for AI/ML, including CI/CD pipelines and containerization.
Relevant certifications in AI or machine learning.

Title: DATA SCIENTIST (M/H)
Description:
Join Satlink, a leading company in the development of solutions for ocean sustainability and satellite communication solutions. Our mission is to develop advanced technologies that contribute to a more sustainable and connected future. In our team, we value creativity, collaboration, and the constant pursuit of innovative solutions.




At Satlink, we are looking for a passionate and highly skilled Data Analyst to join our Technology team. This role is crucial for interpreting complex data and transforming it into information that can drive our strategic decisions.




Role and responsibilities:




Data analysis: Analyse large data sets to identify patterns, trends and correlations, and use statistical and mathematical techniques to interpret data and solve complex problems.
Data Processing: Data processing, exploratory analysis, model development and optimisation, visualisation of results.
Predictive modelling, advanced analytics: Using machine learning techniques and statistical modelling to predict future trends and perform advanced analytics, such as predictive analytics, to support specific business strategies.
Data optimisation: Collect data from a variety of internal and external sources, cleanse and process it to ensure quality and accuracy.
Reporting and data visualisation: Create reports, dashboards and visualisations that communicate findings clearly and effectively to different audiences, and regularly present the results of analysis to stakeholders to support decision making.
Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven solutions.




Qualifications and training requirements:




Educational background: Ideally a bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Mathematics, and a master's degree related to Data Science or Business Analytics.
Experience: Minimum 2 years of relevant experience in data science.
Programming languages: Demonstrated experience in Python, PySpark and R.
Algorithmics: Proficiency in the development and application of advanced machine learning and statistical algorithms, including techniques such as regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modelling, clustering, decision trees and neural networks, among others.
Processing and working with tabular data: Competence in the use of tools and languages for the analysis and manipulation of tabular data such as Pandas, Numpy, SQL for data manipulation and analysis, Excel, etc.
Data visualisation: Desirable knowledge of tools such as matplotlib, ggplot2, plotly, and/or platforms such as Grafana, Tableau or PowerBI.
Agile methodologies: Desirable knowledge of Scrum and Kanban.
Languages: Intermediate level of English (B2).




Desirable Skills:




Ability to identify trends, patterns and anomalies in data.
Understanding of basic statistical concepts and the ability to interpret and evaluate big data models.
Ability to understand business objectives and how data can contribute to achieving them.
Effective communication skills and ability to translate complex findings into information that is accessible and useful to non-technical stakeholders
Interest in technology and continuous learning




Are you ready to join a team that is making a difference in the world of satellite communications? At Satlink, we are eager to meet talented and motivated professionals like you. Join us and start your journey towards a more sustainable and connected future!




In compliance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679, we inform you that your personal data will be processed by Satlink S.L. for the purpose of including your application in our recruitment processes. You can exercise your data protection rights at info@satlink.es. You can find additional information about the processing of your data in our Privacy Policy published at www.satlink.es.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Analyzing, designing, developing, and managing the infrastructure to release scalable Data Science models. The ML Engineer is expected to deploy, monitor and operate production grade AI systems in a scalable, automated, and repeatable way.

Job Description


Create and maintain a scalable infrastructure to deliver AI/ML processes, responding to the user requests in near real time.
Design and implement the pipelines for training and deployment of ML models
Design dashboards to monitor a system
Collect metrics and create alerts based on them
Design and execute performance tests
Perform feasibility studies/analysis with a critical point of view
Support and maintain (troubleshoot issues with data and applications)
Develop technical documentation for applications, including diagrams and manuals
Working on many different software challenges always ensuring a combination of simplicity and maintainability within the code
Contribute to architectural designs of large complexity and size, potentially involving several distinct software components
Mentoring other engineers fostering good engineering practices across the department
Working closely with data scientists and a variety of end-users (across diverse cultures) to ensure technical compatibility and user satisfaction
Work as a member of a team, encouraging team building, motivation and cultivating effective team relations


Qualifications

Role Requirements E=essential, P=preferred

P - Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field

P - Master’s degree in data engineering or related

E - Demonstrated experience and knowledge in Linux and Docker containers

E - Demonstrated experience and knowledge in some of the main cloud providers (Azure, GCP or AWS)

P - Demonstrated experience and knowledge in distributed systems

E - Proficient in programming languages: Python

E – Experience with ML/Ops technologies like Azure ML

E – Self driving and good communication skills

P – Experience with AI/ML frameworks: Torch, Onnx, Tensorflow

E - Experience designing and implementing CICD pipelines for automation.

P - Experience designing monitoring dashboards (Grafana or similar)

P - Experience with container orchestrators (Kubernetes, Docker Swarm.

E - Experience in using collaborative developing tools such as Git, Confluence, Jira, etc. E - Problem-solving capabilities.

E - Strong ability to analyze and synthesize. (Good analytical and logical thinking capability) E - Proactive attitude, resolutive, used to work in a team and manage deadlines

Additional Information

Flexible work model - the Team is meeting at the office 1or 2 a month.

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion
